instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed TIM Test - Plimit not as expected -Processor
threads.message:
Board/ Mac appeared to have no liquid exposure or drop damage. Light, no power.
Found <RESISTOR>R7236</RESISTOR> had some corrosion and <CAPACITOR>C7374</CAPACITOR> was bad. Replaced these and <RESISTOR>R7237</RESISTOR>. 
Powered on but failed the Processor TIM 0 and TIM extended tests. Appears to think the CPU temp is not appropriate?

Also, after looking over the board I’ve replaced <CHIP>U1845</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed TIM Test - Plimit not as expected -Processor
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset first.
SPI chip isn't touched?

I hope you didn't put a normal resistor in place of <RESISTOR>R7237</RESISTOR>; that is NTC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed TIM Test - Plimit not as expected -Processor
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 41289"]Do PRAM reset first.
SPI chip isn't touched?

I hope you didn't put a normal resistor in place of <RESISTOR>R7237</RESISTOR>; that is NTC...[/QUOTE]

Swapped all components from a like donor. 
SPI area looks fine. Board wasn’t ever touched or even removed prior. 
Will do PRAM once out of the ultrasonic. 

I read on another post that on a retina the battery can affect the Plimit? Never seen this failure before and have run plenty even with no batt.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed TIM Test - Plimit not as expected -Processor
threads.message: *correction. I actually did a PRAM reset after I got it back in the case because I didn’t have the long dong.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed TIM Test - Plimit not as expected -Processor
threads.message: Check <RESISTOR>R7235</RESISTOR> and traces from NTC to <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed TIM Test - Plimit not as expected -Processor
threads.message:
I was about to consider it done and call it an ASD issue because it seemed to operate normal..
However, I checked the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> area - everything measured normal but <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> seemed off a bit. Replaced and it passes all diagnostics now. 
Thanks for the help. We can mark this one solved.
